meanings.definition: To make or become oriental in character or style.
meanings.sent1: She tried to orientalize her living room by adding silk curtains and bamboo furniture.
meanings.sent2: The artist chose to orientalize the landscape by incorporating traditional Japanese motifs.
meanings.sent3: The chef accidentally orientalized the pasta dish by adding soy sauce instead of marinara.
meanings.sent4: The music producer decided to orientalize the song with the addition of a sitar melody.
meanings.sent5: The interior designer's goal was to orientalize the space with rich colors and intricate patterns.

meanings.definition: To view or portray in an oriental manner.
meanings.sent1: The filmmaker wanted to orientalize the characters by dressing them in traditional attire.
meanings.sent2: Some Western artists tend to orientalize Eastern cultures in their paintings.
meanings.sent3: The comedian humorously orientalized his impression of a famous actor.
meanings.sent4: Her dream was like a movie scene, where everything was orientalized with vibrant colors.
meanings.sent5: The author's vivid descriptions orientalized the setting, transporting readers to a different world.
